titleStmt.title: William K[unknown] et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4515

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thomas, E, Bramlette Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky We the undersigned petitioners & Citizens of Boyd County Respectly Salicit The Remmitences of the fines agst Doctor Wm Pugh who was fined at the last November term of the Boyd Circuit Court sixty dollars for keeping a tippling House Doctor Wm Pugh is a Drugess in our town, and being under the impression as the Keeper of a Drug Store he ^had^ the law full right to sell whisky when most parties repersented it was for a medical purpose and he did not violate the law willfuly but only through ingnarance He being an Englishman and not understanding the laws of our state Doctor Pugh is a good Citizen and useful man in our Community and ^we^ pray and ask ^you^ to Release him of the fine aforesaid

Names
James W Riely
W, A, Foster
H M Childs
